Song.title: Take My Life And Let It Be
Song.copyright: Words by Frances Havergal Music by Henri Malan Public domain

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: [D]Take my [D/F#]life, and [D]let it [D/F#]be [D]Consecr[Em]ated, [G]Lord, [A7sus4]to [D]Thee. [D]Take my [Em]moments [G]and my [D/F#]days [D]Let them [Em]flow in [D/F#]ceaseless [Em]praise. [D]Let [Em]them [D/F#]flow in [G]cease[A7sus4]less [D]praise.
Verse 2: [D]Take my [D/F#]hands and [D]let them [D/F#]move [D]At the [Em]impulse [G]of [A7sus4]Thy [D]love [D]Take my [Em]feet and [G]let them [D/F#]be [D]Swift and [Em]beauti[D/F#]ful for [Em]Thee [D]Swift [Em]and [D/F#]beauti[G]ful [A7sus4]for [D]Thee
Verse 3: [D]Take my [D/F#]voice, and [D]let me [D/F#]sing [D]Always, [Em]only, [G]for [A7sus4]my [D]King. [D]Take my [Em]lips, and [G]let them [D/F#]be [D]Filled with [Em]messa[D/F#]ges from [Em]Thee. [D]Filled [Em]with [D/F#]messa[G]ges [A7sus4]from [D]Thee.
{new_page} Verse 4: [D]Take my [D/F#]silver [D]and my [D/F#]gold; [D]Not a [Em]mite would [G]I [A7sus4]with[D]hold. [D]Take my [Em]intel[G]lect, and [D/F#]use [D]Every [Em]pow’r as [D/F#]Thou shalt [Em]choose. [D]Eve[Em]ry [D/F#]pow’r as [G]Thou [A7sus4]shalt [D]choose.
Verse 5: [D]Take my [D/F#]will, and [D]make it [D/F#]Thine; [D]It shall [Em]be no [G]lon[A7sus4]ger [D]mine. [D]Take my [Em]heart, it [G]is Thine [D/F#]own; [D]It shall [Em]be Thy [D/F#]royal [Em]throne. [D]It [Em]shall [D/F#]be Thy [G]roy[A7sus4]al [D]throne.
Verse 6: [D]Take my [D/F#]love, my [D]Lord, I [D/F#]pour [D]At Thy [Em]feet its [G]trea[A7sus4]sure [D]store. [D]Take my[Em]self, and [G]I will [D/F#]be [D]Ever, [Em]only, [D/F#]all for [Em]Thee. [D]Ev[Em]er, [D/F#]only, [G]all [A7sus4]for [D]Thee.
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 take my life and let it be consecrated lord to thee take my moments and my days let them flow in ceaseless praise let them flow in ceaseless praise verse 2 take my hands and let them move at the impulse of thy love take my feet and let them be swift and beautiful for thee swift and beautiful for thee verse 3 take my voice and let me sing always only for my king take my lips and let them be filled with messages from thee filled with messages from thee verse 4 take my silver and my gold not a mite would i withhold take my intellect and use every powr as thou shalt choose every powr as thou shalt choose verse 5 take my will and make it thine it shall be no longer mine take my heart it is thine own it shall be thy royal throne it shall be thy royal throne verse 6 take my love my lord i pour at thy feet its treasure store take myself and i will be ever only all for thee ever only all for thee

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: [D]Take my [D/F#]life, and [G]let [A7]it [D]be [Bm]Consecr[Bm7]ated, [Em7]Lord, [A7sus4]to [D]Thee. [D]Take my [Em]moments [G]and [A7sus4]my [Dsus D]days [D/F#]Let them [G]flow [D/F#]in [Em]ceaseless [A7sus A]praise. [Bm]Let [Bm7]them [G]flow [Em]in [A7sus]cease[A7]less [D]praise.
Verse 2: [D]Take my [D/F#]hands and [G]let [A7]them [D]move [Bm]At the [Bm7]impulse [Em7]of [A7sus4]Thy [D]love [D]Take my [Em]feet and [G]let [A7sus4]them [Dsus D]be [D/F#]Swift and [G]beau[D/F#]ti[Em]ful for [A7sus A]Thee [Bm]Swift [Bm7]and [G]beau[Em]ti[A7sus]ful [A7]for [D]Thee
Verse 3: [D]Take my [D/F#]voice, and [G]let [A7]me [D]sing [Bm]Always, [Bm7]only, [Em7]for [A7sus4]my [D]King. [D]Take my [Em]lips, and [G]let them [Dsus D]be [D/F#]Filled with [G]mes[D/F#]sa[Em]ges from [A7sus A]Thee. [Bm]Filled [Bm7]with [G]mes[Em]sa[A7sus]ges [A7]from [D]Thee.
{new_page} Verse 4: [D]Take my [D/F#]silver [G]and [A7]my [D]gold; [Bm]Not a [Bm7]mite would [Em7]I [A7sus4]with[D]hold. [D]Take my [Em]intel[G]lect, and [Dsus D]use [D/F#]Every [G]pow’r [D/F#]as [Em]Thou shalt [A7sus A]choose. [Bm]Eve[Bm7]ry [G]pow’r [Em]as [A7sus]Thou [A7]shalt [D]choose.
Verse 5: [D]Take my [D/F#]will, and [G]make [A7]it [D]Thine; [Bm]It shall [Bm7]be no [Em7]lon[A7sus4]ger [D]mine. [D]Take my [Em]heart, it [G]is Thine [Dsus D]own; [D/F#]It shall [G]be [D/F#]Thy [Em]royal [A7sus A]throne. [Bm]It [Bm7]shall [G]be [Em]Thy [A7sus]roy[A7]al [D]throne.
Verse 6: [D]Take my [D/F#]love, my [G]Lord, [A7]I [D]pour [Bm]At Thy [Bm7]feet its [Em7]trea[A7sus4]sure [D]store. [D]Take my[Em]self, and [G]I will [Dsus D]be [D/F#]Ever, [G]on[D/F#]ly, [Em]all for [A7sus A]Thee. [Bm]Ev[Bm7]er, [G]on[Em]ly, [A7sus]all [A7]for [D]Thee.
